alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 10:01AM CDT until April 25 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. .Red River basin river flooding to continues. New snowmelt will result in a slow, gradual recession of the Buffalo River near Dilworth. The river is expected to fall into Action stage by mid this week. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Dilworth. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Monday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 10.8 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
